newsitem.title: SPAIN: Madrid stock index surges after rate cut, Wall St.
newsitem.headline: Madrid stock index surges after rate cut, Wall St.

text.p: Madrid's general stock index started sharply higher on Tuesday bolstered by a 25 basis point key rate cut as well as a strong rebound on Wall Street yesterday, dealers said.
The general index opened up 1.09 percent, 5.20 points, to 481.64.
At 0815 GMT the Ibex-35 blue chip index was up 63.99 points, 1.17 percent, to 5,516.51
The Bank of Spain cut its key money rate to 5.50 percent this morning, as widely expected. Analysts predict further rate cuts this year.
